sn1.40:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Vesali in the Great Wood, in the Hall with the Peaked Roof.
sn1.40:1.3: Then, when the night had advanced, Cūḷakokanada, Pajjunna’s younger daughter, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Great Wood, approached the Blessed One.
sn1.40:1.4: Having approached, she paid homage to the Blessed One, stood to one side, and recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.40:2.1: Beautiful as the gleam of lightning.
sn1.40:2.3: Venerating the Buddha and the Dhamma,
sn1.40:2.4: She spoke these verses full of meaning.
sn1.40:3.1: That I might analyse it in many ways,
sn1.40:3.2: “Though the Dhamma is of such a nature
sn1.40:3.3: I will state its meaning briefly
sn1.40:3.4: To the extent I have learnt it by heart.
sn1.40:4.1: “One should do no evil in all the world,
sn1.40:4.2: Not by speech, mind, or body.
sn1.40:4.3: Having abandoned sense pleasures, Mindful and clearly comprehending,
sn1.40:4.4: One should not pursue a course That is painful and harmful. ”
